DOCNAME: CASE OF MAGALHAES PEREIRA v. PORTUGAL
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 5-4;Not necessary to examine Art. 5-1;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant is a NORP national , born in DATE . He was a lawyer and is currently detained in the GPE do ORG secure psychiatric unit in NORP ( GPE ) .
CARDINAL . The applicant , who was suspected of fraud , was arrested on DATE and placed in pre - trial detention .

CARDINAL . During the proceedings against him the applicant was examined by a psychiatrist . In his report of DATE the psychiatrist concluded that the applicant was suffering from residual schizophrenia and should be given long - term psychiatric treatment .

CARDINAL . NORP In a judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG held that , on account of his mentally disturbed state , the applicant was not criminally responsible ( inimputável ) and was dangerous . It accordingly ordered that he be detained for a maximum period of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was transferred to the GPE do ORG secure psychiatric unit .
CARDINAL . In an order of DATE a judge of ORG decided that , in accordance with the relevant legislation , the mandatory periodic review of the applicant 's detention should take place on DATE .

CARDINAL . The applicant 's file was transmitted to ORG das GPE ) . On DATE the judge of that court assigned a lawyer to represent the applicant , who had not chosen CARDINAL himself . He also asked the staff of the GPE do PERSON secure unit to prepare an initial report on the applicant 's condition .

CARDINAL . In a letter of DATE PERSON informed the judge that the applicant was “ clinically balanced ” . He added that his behavoiur “ [ was ] adequate and he [ could ] be released on probation [ liberdade para prova ] if he agree[d ] to accept psychiatric support outside and [ took ] his medication ” .
CARDINAL . In an order of DATE the judge decided to await the expiry of the time - limits provided for in LAW .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant personally lodged an application for release , relying on Dr M.S.C. 's favourable opinion . On DATE the judge marked the file as “ seen ” ( visto ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the judge asked ORG , in accordance with the relevant legislation , to submit its opinion on the applicant 's social situation and asked ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) to carry out a medical examination .

CARDINAL . ORG submitted its report on DATE , concluding that the applicant 's circumstances were such that he could be released on probation . A medical examination was carried out on DATE . The ORG filed a report also on CARDINAL DATE concluding that the applicant remained a danger to society .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant personally lodged a further application for release , relying on , inter alia , LAW .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was examined by the judge . As the applicant 's officially assigned lawyer was not present , the judge appointed an officer from the GPE do ORG secure psychiatric unit as his defence counsel . The applicant stated , among other things , that he considered himself to have recovered and that the medicines which he was still taking were unnecessary .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant personally lodged a further application for release . On CARDINAL and DATE he filed pleadings criticising the ORG 's medical report .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG asked ORG for a copy of the latest decision relating to the periodic review of the applicant 's detention . On DATE the judge indicated that no decision had yet been taken .
CARDINAL . The applicant absconded during prison leave CARDINAL . He was captured on DATE when the police authorities found him at his family home .

CARDINAL . In a decision of DATE ORG decided to keep the applicant in detention . The judge based his decision on the ORG 's report of CARDINAL DATE first , before stressing that it was clear that the applicant , who had absconded during prison leave , was not in a position to prove himself worthy of the trust that the prison system had placed in him . Lastly , the judge considered that , on account of the applicant 's mentally disturbed state , the applications for release he had lodged personally did not have to be examined .

CARDINAL . The applicant personally appealed against that decision to ORG ) . However , in an order of CARDINAL DATE the judge of ORG decided not to examine his appeal , noting that the applicant had been admitted to a secure psychiatric unit and was represented by officially assigned counsel , and that the President of ORG had delivered a decision on DATE in habeas corpus proceedings to the effect that no other request for habeas corpus submitted by the applicant himself would be examined on account of his mentally disturbed state .

CARDINAL . On an unknown date the applicant personally appealed against that order to ORG . However , the judge of ORG made an order on DATE stating that he would not examine the appeal and referring to the reasons stated in his order of CARDINAL February CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged , through Mr PERSON , an application with ORG challenging the judge of ORG dealing with his case . In a judgment of DATE , ORG granted his application , a new judge being appointed .

CARDINAL . On DATE the public prosecutor requested the applicant 's release since he presented no further danger . In a decision of DATE the judge dismissed that request and decided to review the situation at the next periodic review ( scheduled for DATE ) . The public prosecutor appealed against that decision to ORG .
CARDINAL . In a judgment of DATE ORG dismissed the appeal .
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of LAW , as amended by LAW no . CARDINAL of DATE , are as follows :

“ Persons suffering from a mental disorder who are incapable at the material time of appreciating the unlawful nature or the consequences of their actions shall not be held criminally responsible for those actions . ”

“ CARDINAL . A person who commits a punishable offence and who is found not to be criminally responsible within the meaning of Article CARDINAL shall be ordered to be detained in an asylum , hospital or secure unit , if there is reason to believe , in view of his mental illness and the nature and seriousness of his offence , that he may commit further serious offences .

CARDINAL . Where the offence committed by a person found not to be criminally responsible is an offence against the person or a crime punishable by DATE imprisonment , he shall be ordered to be detained for DATE , save where his release is not incompatible with the protection of the legal system and public order . ”

“ Without prejudice to the provisions of paragraph CARDINAL of the preceding Article , detention shall cease when the court finds that the justification for the detention no longer exists because the detainee is no longer criminally dangerous . ”
“ CARDINAL . The court may at any time hear an application relying on a ground for the cessation of the detention measure .
CARDINAL . NORP The court shall , of its own motion , regardless of whether any application has been made , review the detention DATE after it began or after the decision extending it .

CARDINAL . The Code of Criminal Procedure and Legislative Decree no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL of DATE setting up sentence - supervision courts lay down the appropriate procedure to be followed . Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL of the Code of Criminal Procedure provide :

“ CARDINAL . A personal file shall be opened in the establishment in which the person is to be detained in which shall be registered or placed all documents received from or sent to the court together with periodic reports on the effects of the treatment on the dangerousness of the detainee .
CARDINAL . NORP The governor of the establishment shall send the periodic reports to the sentence - supervision court DATE and when justified by the circumstances or requested by the court . ”
“ CARDINAL . Up until DATE prior to the date scheduled for the mandatory review of the detainee 's situation , the sentence - supervision court shall order
( a ) a psychiatric or character report , if possible in the establishment where the detainee is detained , which must be submitted to the court within DATE ;
( b ) of its own motion , or at the request of the public prosecutor , the detainee or the lawyer , measures likely to assist it in reaching a decision .
CARDINAL . Up until DATE the social rehabilitation services shall send a report on the detainee 's family and professional environment .

CARDINAL . The mandatory review of the detainee 's situation shall be conducted after hearing submissions from the public prosecutor , the lawyer and the detainee ; the latter must be present , save where his state of health renders such hearing purposeless or impossible .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of LAW , which applies as an alternative provision in proceedings before ORG , provides DATE in urgent cases , where it is not possible to find a member or trainee member of the Bar , that the judge may officially assign an appropriate person without legal qualifications to represent the accused . In judgment no . CARDINAL of DATE ( Boletim do PERSON no . CARDINAL , p. CARDINAL ) , ORG held that the appointment of a court - registry official as the accused 's defence counsel did not infringe the rights of the defence , as guaranteed by LAW .
